question: Complete the sentence: I am not as tall _____ my brother.
options: as
than
like
answer: as

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: There is less people here than expected.
There are fewer people here than expected.
There is fewer people here than expected.
answer: There are fewer people here than expected.

question: Which sentence is correctly using a relative pronoun?
options: The man that I met was kind.
The man whom I met was kind.
The man which I met was kind.
answer: The man whom I met was kind.

question: Complete the sentence: It is high time you _____ to bed.
options: went
go
gone
answer: went

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: I have been studying for two hours.
I have studied for two hours.
I have studying for two hours.
answer: I have been studying for two hours.

question: Which sentence correctly uses a conditional?
options: If I see him, I will speak to him.
If I will see him, I speak to him.
If I see him, I speak to him.
answer: If I see him, I will speak to him.

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: I didn't do nothing yesterday.
I didn't do anything yesterday.
I didn't do something yesterday.
answer: I didn't do anything yesterday.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: He has less friends than her.
He has fewer friends than her.
He has few friends than her.
answer: He has fewer friends than her.

question: Complete the sentence: If I _____ you, I would reconsider the offer.
options: was
were
am
answer: were

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: They doesn't know the answer.
They don't know the answer.
They doesn't knows the answer.
answer: They don't know the answer.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: I had a dream last night.

I had dream last night.
answer: I had a dream last night.

question: Complete the sentence: I would have helped you if I _____ about it.
options: knew
had known
know
answer: had known

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: Where did you bought that car?
Where did you buy that car?

answer: Where did you buy that car?

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: Neither the teacher nor the student were to blame.
Neither the teacher nor the student was to blame.
Neither the teacher nor the student are to blame.
answer: Neither the teacher nor the student was to blame.

question: Complete the sentence: Not only _____ the exam hard, but he also aced it.
options: did he study
he studied
studied he
answer: did he study

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: We should leave now if we want to catch the train.
We should to leave now if we want to catch the train.
We should leaving now if we want to catch the train.
answer: We should leave now if we want to catch the train.

question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: This is the best cake I have ever eaten.
This is the best cake I ever ate.
This is the best cake I had ever eaten.
answer: This is the best cake I have ever eaten.

question: Complete the sentence: As soon as the show ended, everyone _____.
options: left
leaves
had left
answer: left

question: Choose the sentence that uses the subjunctive correctly.
options: It is essential that she be here on time.
It is essential that she is here on time.
It is essential that she are here on time.
answer: It is essential that she be here on time.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: If I were you, I would apologize.
If I was you, I would apologize.
If I be you, I would apologize.
answer: If I were you, I would apologize.

question: Complete the sentence: They will start the meeting _____ everyone arrives.
options: as soon as
when
immediately after
answer: as soon as

question: Choose the correct sentence.
options: He drives more careful than his brother.
He drives more carefully than his brother.
He drives carefullly than his brother.
answer: He drives more carefully than his brother.

question: Which sentence is correctly structured?
options: Hardly had I arrived when the rain started.
Hardly I had arrived when the rain started.
I had hardly arrived when the rain started.
answer: Hardly had I arrived when the rain started.

question: Complete the sentence: By the time you arrive, I _____ my lunch.
options: will finish
will have finished
will finishing
answer: will have finished

question: Choose the sentence.
options: The book which I borrowed was fascinating.
The book whom I borrowed was fascinating.
The book that I borrowed was fascinating.
answer: The book that I borrowed was fascinating.

question: Which sentence is correct?
options: She only said that she was tired.
Only she said that she was tired.
She said only that she was tired.

options: have
had

answer: had

options: If you mix red and blue, you gets purple.
If you mix red and blue, you get purple.
If you mix red and blue, you getting purple.

options: The team has won every match this season.

The team is won every match this season.
answer: The team has won every match this season.

question: Complete the sentence: Although it was raining, they _____ for a walk.
options: went
go
are going

options: After dinner we went to the movie.

options: Each of the players are ready.

options: They is watching TV.

options: She has been reading for two hours.

options: have
